page.title: 11THE TANNERY, KINGHORN (1)
page.content: Just to the north of Kinghorn is the town's only manufacturing industry, Kinghorn Tannery. This factory provides employment for 120 people, and processes hides from all over Scotland. The hides and sheepskins are brought to the tannery for sorting, grading, weighing, trimming and preservation prior to their eventual sale. The British Standards are used to grade the hides according to weight and quality. Selected sheepskins are selected and used to manufacture sheep- skin rugs, and the others are sold for conversion into shammy leathers or sheepskin garments. The bovine hides are sold to finishing tanners, and it would probably, therefore, be more accurate to describe the factory as a{fellmongery} rather than a tannery.
